newsitem.title: RUSSIA: TASS plans to double Russia long distance capacity.
newsitem.headline: TASS plans to double Russia long distance capacity.

text.p: Russian news agency ITAR-TASS and U.S. Transworld Communications Inc. have launched a long-distance telephone network that will begin operation this year, with plans to double public network capacity, Transworld said Friday.
The network has a license to work with the main domestic telephone network and will work in cooperation with domestic long distance companies, officials said.
Andrei Grigoriyev, chief executive of the company, called TASS-Loutch Telecom, said sales would be in the billions of dollars.

Transworld's Advanced Communications Technologies subsidiary and TASS's Tass-Telecom subsidiary each have 50 percent stakes in the deal, he said. Privately held Transworld Communications is based in McLean, Va.
